definitions.definition: If two or more lines, streets, etc. are parallel, the distance between them is the same all along their length:
examples: Draw a pair of parallel lines.

definitions.definition: something very similar to something else, or a similarity between two things:
examples: I'm trying to see if there are any obvious parallels between the two cases.

definitions.definition: If something has no parallel or is without parallel, there is nothing similar to it or of the same high quality as it:
examples: These beautiful African churches have no parallel in Europe.

definitions.definition: to happen at the same time as something else, or be similar or equal to something else:
examples: The events of the last ten days in some ways parallel those before the 1978 election.

definitions.definition: in a position that is always the same distance from something else:
examples: It's a quiet street running (= positioned) parallel to the main road.
